Key Match Events: Nikola Jovic made the tying layup and go-ahead foul shot with 7.8 seconds left to send the Miami Heat past the Minnesota Timberwolves 95-94 and stop their three-game losing streak on Sunday night.
Post-Match Reflections: The Miami Heat stopped their three-game losing streak on Sunday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tyler Herro had 26 points for the Heat, who played without star Jimmy Butler.
Anthony Edwards scored 22 points on 8-for-24 shooting for the Wolves.
Others: The Heat made Minnesota's offense just as much of a mess as theirs with 23 turnovers, 14 steals, and nine blocks, all season highs.
